inn1.comm: starts well, landing on a good length and curving the ball away, Gilchrist shouldering arms
a tighter one, still that good length but slightly closer to the batsman who waits for it to curl out a touch before defending on the back foot
oh, took the outside edge at 126kph, the ball shooting wide of the slips as he pressed forward in a would-be drive
some good carry there, the ball finding that good length once more and zinging up and away, Sangakkara taking it on the rise
pushed through again, another dot delivery as it's left on the way through
still no run to him as the batsman waits for the ball just outside off and defends on the back foot
starts outside off, the batsman waiting and then moving into the line of the ball which he drives off the back foot on the up through the covers
gets into line on off and defends down off the back foot
gun-barrel straight again, on line with off stick, defended behind off the back foot
slings down across the left hander, the ball forced wide away from him and he leaves it, Sangakkara taking it around his ankles
not much bounce there, the ball ekeing on past the left hander
on middle and leg, turned well off the knee to midwicket
like a rocket. Hayden comes down the track, stands tall and shoulders the ball over mid-off for a firmly, sweetly struck four
on middle and off, again Hayden shows his intent by coming out and turning the ball through midwicket
but hello, good response from Vaas who hits the deck in line with off and it deviates off the seam with a hint of swing, beating the bat well - and just failing to take the edge
outside off, a shortish delivery which is helped into the off-side with a dink off the back foot
tightened him up with a good one that was on to him in a hurry, the batsman waiting and defending down off the back foot
excellent length again, the ball pitching just outside off and moving away from the left hander who pushes off the back foot, more defensively than anything
stays over the wicket and plants the ball on a decent length past the batsman who lets it go on through
outside off, jumped onto a hint of length, driven out to the covers
flings it down past the left hander once more
ramrod straight, up there, forces the batsman to bring down his arms very quickly to defend on the back foot
licks it down off at a good pace, the batsman judges well to leave it
and again, to round off a good start of a maiden over
well bowled, taking the edge through the vacant second slip area, the batsman flashing hard and getting away with it
tightened up down off on a good length, defended in the line
Gilchrist advances down the track to meet one which pitched on middle and went on to hit leg as his vain would-be aerial swish towards midwicket got nowhere near the ball
the left armer stays over to the right hander and forces him to defend outside off on the front foot
well bowled again, Ponting lets that one through
swings back in to the right hander, late, and forced up there, Ponting quick to jump into a defence
good line across the left hander who waits, meets the ball outside off, and defends on the front foot
good line again, pushed past the left hander on a decent length, and he shoulders arms
pushed wide down off and it's left alone deliberately as the ball bounces quite high as well
hits a good length this time, across the left hander, who once more leaves
continues to plug the off-side channel, the batsman once again leaving it
waits on off and defends once more, on the front foot
plenty of wobble as the ball shimmies down past the left hander
flings the ball down the off-side channel from over the wicket, left alone
Ponting is watchful again, the ball slotting on off and pushed up there forcing him to defend on the front foot
dropped! Dilshan in the gully put it down, the ball was outside off and short, Ponting popped up hard and it ran up Dilshan's arms on the forward dive
outside off, an angled bat on the front-foot defensive
short ball on off, defended on the back foot now
on off, rises onto the back foot and defends down
pushed well again past the left hander who makes an elaborate gesture of a leave
too straight on middle and leg, Hayden tucks it off the legs and has already set off as Jayasuriya runs round to do the tidying up
driven out to mid-off and there was a chance of a run-out there, Hayden was struggling and had to dive in the end, a direct hit from Malinga would have been comfortably out
down the off-side channel and Ponting judges well, and early, to leave it
on middle and leg, Ponting comes down the track and turns the ball out through the 45, not the most convincing shot
steps outside off and exaggerates the leave with the bat high in the air
pushed down the off-side channel on a good length and there's a hint of swing back in
swing into the lefthander who defends on the back foot
some curl away from the left hander who defends on the front foot this time
shortish on middle and leg, just a hint of room which is enough for Hayden to fashion some kind of room in turning the ball through the 45
a touch outside off this time, Hayden waits and moves into the line of the ball, defending back down off the back foot
movement away outside off, but only just, defended on the back foot down
good length on off, defended on the front foot, right down the line
right through him, regulation delivery down off, Ponting pushes out away from his body and the ball jinks between bat and pad
outside off, defended on the front foot this time
width outside off, cut hard to the fielder who knocked it down and they come back for a comfortable two, poor from Jayasuriya who had a gaping hole in his long barrier
in line with off, defended on the front foot now
overpitched a touch on off, driven out to mid-off
on off, waits on the back foot to push out to mid-on, rock-solid defensive play
outside off, on the back foot, played down to the gully
advances down the track, looking for a huge booming drive through mid-off, but is tucked up by the length and has to settle for a gentle drive
outside off, decent length, defended down
a touch down leg and Hayden thumps behind square leg where the ball bounces once on its way to the fielder, deviates, and is jumped on well and returned
a play and a miss, an ugly shot from Ponting who gets on the back foot and tries to cut off the back foot to point
starts wideish of the crease over the wicket and doesn't bring it back in enough, the batsman defending forward
on off and middle, defended forward
on off and middle again, more good length and defended on the front foot
full delivery, almost a yorker, Hayden clamps down on it with a forward defensive
tidy delivery yet again and Hayden waits to defend on the back foot
advances down, meets the ball outside off and presses off the front foot to square and they gratefully take the opportunity to push the stagnating score on
on the shiny button immediately, and the batsman can only leave it
jumped into the line of the ball outside off and defended on the back foot
fired across him, up there, and defended on the front foot
outside off, played off the back foot out to point
outside off, pushes him on to the back foot in defence
swung past the right hander, width enough to leave
wide down off and Ponting could have left it to get the extra, but I expect he tried to play it to get used to getting bat on ball - as it was he hardly got any contact on what would have been a cut
good slower ball, Ponting picks it and brushes out a mid-on drive, Vaas  slings back in to the non-striker's and just misses
slower ball, a brush of an on-drive, Vaas at mid-on nearly takes the sticks
a big shot now, Hayden down and heaped it out to square, but not quite connecting in the end
outside off, Ponting waits and presses out to point where Malinga comes round and wings back in
pushed across him, Hayden steps to the side like a 1980s aerobic move and works the ball down off the back foot into the off-side
outside off, a better shot from Ponting who waits and forces down through point where it's chased down inside the boundary
on middle, Hayden rockets it hard through midwicket with a swivel
outside off, Hayden waits for it on the back foot and cuts well through the off-side and they return for an easy two
very good delivery, almost a yorker, on off and defended on the front foot
outside off, a short ball and rising, Ponting eases it off the back foot to point
short ball, nearly a wide it was so high, and Ponting goes for the hook outside off but it was past him before he'd played the shot

slower ball deceives Hayden, pushed across him and the batsman was looking to work the ball to leg from outside off, instead popping up to cover where Silva takes a good catch, leaving the ground to take it over his head
comes out and defends on the front foot now
pushed down the channel, left alone
swing in to the right hander, tucking him up, he squeezes back out to mid-on where a direct hit would have had him well out, Clarke losing the bat as he ran through
outside off and Ponting clips it back off his legs through midwicket
fired on the off-side, good length, tidied back down on the front foot
more good bowling, fast and flat on off, defended on the front foot
angling down leg, clipped off the ankles to square
outside off, driven hard into the ground towards point where Dilshan fields very well to cut it off
dug into the ground back towards the bowler
swivelled in outside off, on the dot again, defended into the ground off the back foot
straight, short and defended back down
nipped back in from outside off, defended back down
right up there, defended on the front foot
outside off, tight, driven back to mid-off
slower ball, good loop, outside off and a good length and defended forward
outside off, pushed out to the covers where the fielder gets a left hand to it and they scamper through

great fielding there, a mix-up between the batsmen as Ponting pushes forward and wants the single. Maharoof dives out to his right to stop the ball and as it dribbles away from him he recovers and flings hard to Sangakkara who does the honours
finds the dot immediately, defended on the front foot
more defence on the front foot
more defence
on leg, turned out behind square
driven out to the covers on the front foot
turned down leg to short fine leg
slower ball, well judged because the batsman was temporarily fooled, just tucking the ball up slightly but down safe to the covers
pushed down the off-side, left alone
outside off, a quick push down and they run through, hari-kiri-style as the bowler underarms on to the stumps at the striker's end, but Clarke was just in
pushed off the back foot into the covers
on middle, turned off the legs behind square where Amerasinghe chases and his pursuit is successful
on middle, turned to midwicket
on off, shortish and pulled through midwicket
outside off, and cut down off the back foot through gully
stayed over, pushed across the right hander, who drove out to the covers
driven out to the covers off the back foot
pushed to point off the back foot
outside off, a touch short, cut hard to point off the back foot

a huge call from Sangakkara as he believes Symonds inside-edged just a feather through to him and indeed he has, his feet trapped in the crease as he fended away from his body to the ball which came outside off on a good length
squares Hussey up first ball, defended somehow
defended on the front foot this time
straight on leg, defended on the front foot now
..but he clicks now with one which jinks past the outside edge on the front foot
comes out on the front foot, drives to mid-off and steals the strike courtesy of a hash from Malinga
good start from Murali, on middle and pushed past into the off-side
outside off, cut out to point, Hussey not quite getting hold of it
looped up on to leg, pushed out in front of square
outside off, some room, the batsman rocks back and cuts into the covers
vicious rip back into the batsman from outside off and Clarke moves back again to give himself room to cut back out into the off-side
good loop again up there in front of middle, and driven back out square
pushed across him on off, full delivery, driven out to mid-off
a very wide down off, looks like he just slipped, Malinga went to give him an encouraging pat
down off again, this one less wide and left down the channel
overpitched on off, and Hussey drives well through the covers, picking the gap well
outside off, driven out to the covers again, but doesn't pick the gap
waits on off, meets a short one with a back-foot defensive in line with off
bends it down off, a neat length which earns a clap from Sangakkara
pushes him back into the crease with the length, Clarke squeezing out from middle into midwicket
and again, this is good tight bowling and defended on the back foot
up there once more, on off, defended forward
lets that one go down the channel
on leg, turning in, defended back down off the back foot
deliberately gives it some extra air outside off, driven out to mid-off, they go for the run and get back in comfortably from the quick single
defended well on the back foot
tidy delivery, defended on the front foot
good movement just away from the left hander who waits, crouches and opens the face to glide the ball through the gully region
tight one, rising outside off, Clarke defends back down
some swing in the air and the ball radars in on off and middle, driven back out to mid-on
some swing back in on a short one but Clarke was already on to the pull through midwicket
on off, waits and cuts out to point, rocking to make himself some room
outside off, good length, but pushed to the covers, the batsmen setting off immediately
comes out to the covers
let it go on a good length past off
squeezed out to the covers and they are quick off the mark
on off, pushed over to short midwicket
pushed hard down off, left alone
fired up straight, defended on the front foot again. Not much width today
good length, opens the face and the ball just licks past the outside edge
dropped down in front of him, they run through the quick single
outside off, Clarke gets a big edge up high and hard over to third man as he tried to club over mid-on off the front foot, Vaas can't get round to it in time
outside off, defended back down off the back foot
comes out to meet the ball on off for an easy single, driven out to mid-on
round the wicket, Hussey picks the ball from off to fine leg with a cute dink
driven out to long-off without much fuss
in the air a touch from the late cut, but safe down on to third man
pushes him back into the crease, the ball ripping away from the right hander but also from the stumps
cracker from Clarke, quick eyes and hands, cutting a back-of-a-length ball from middle stump
let it go down off, the batsman shouldering arms as a good-length delivery goes on its merry way
touch more width outside off, cut out well through the gully on the crouch and they risk a second
defended down on off
right up there on middle and off, forces the defensive
zoomed up well again, defended forward
just outside leg, turned back down through fine leg
driven out to the covers now
defenfds solidly on the front foot
worked well into the gap on the off-side
pushed on to the pads, looked to turn it out to midwicket but wasn't quick enough
driven out straight this time
good loop, pushed to short midwicket
good ball on off, driven out to straight long-off
outside off, turned down backward of point and they run two to Murali's arm
the same shot but this time Murali is wise to it, and they take only the single
short on off and Clarke pulls it from outside off round through midwicket
a pinched single from a press forward
outside off tempts Clarke into the air-drive outside off
on off, turns wider, Hussey watches it all the way through
pushed up there, defended on the back foot
swept round now on the swivel
a tuoch overpitched, driven out to mid-on
let it go through down off
outside off, turned to short midwicket, Murali misses with the shy
tidy first ball after drinks, defended forward
quiet again, defended on the front foot now
more defence, Clarke getting forward to press into the covers this time, straight to the fielder
outside off, Clarke picks it up early and whips it back in front of midwicket, just wide of mid-on and on its way it goes, creamily
pushes him onto the backfoot to drive into the covers
short ball dabbed down off  the back foot into the covers and he shuffles through to take the strike
pushes him onto the back foot, worked out to midwicket
a quick single this time and back in safely
pushed across him, defended forward
more of the same
and yet again
pushed across him and he lets it go on on a good length
up there on off, driven out to mid-on
on a good length, pushed forward on the front foot, the fielder coming across to cut it off
pushed out on the back foot to mid-off, they took a risk there, a direct hit was gone at the non-striker's
speared down the channel, left alone
too quick on to him, the ball on his thighs in front of off and the ball nearly got trapped in his pad
lets it through down the channel on the rise
uses his feet very well to meet the pitch of the ball on off, driven out hard to mid-off where Amerasinghe oophs it back in
Hussey makes room to work it to midwicket
on middle, driven out forward and well fielded
on leg, up there, pushed into the leg-side
outside off, cut hard to point, more good footwork there
width outside off, cut hard to deep point
straight again, but there's another quick single and they are through quickly with hardly any alarm, the batsman just dropping the ball down
hostile bouncer, sharp, quick and the batsman did well to duck
advanced down the pitch late and waited for the short ball before launching that hard over mid-on, hiitting through the line with a very clean, attractive shot indeed
foure more, down the leg and turned off the hips
Malinga responds with a good straight yorker, dug out in front of middle
another yorker, or at least it would be, dug out with a careful drive to mid-off
stays over, fires across Clarke who's tightened up in front of off and defended on the front foot
ooh, some luck for Clarke who comes out, looking to drive on the front foot through mid-off and instead the ball crashes hard wide of the sticks off an inside edge
comes outside off and drives on the front foot through the covers, connecting properly this time
tight on off but Hussey manages to make some room by late-cutting through the gully
straight delivery on middle, Clarke drives out to mid-on
nips back in from outside off, defended on the front foot
full delivery on off, driven out and they run well through
short on middle and leg, swivelled round off the back foot through square
on the legs, turned out square
outside off, driven out to long-off for a comfortable single
some movement in the air, overpitched a touch, Hussey drives out to long-off and Malinga tidies up
on middle and leg squeezed out to midwicket
slung wide outside off at yorkerable length, but left alone
driven out to mid-off, good fielding there by Perera and Hussey has to get back into his crease quickly
pushed into the off-side off the back foot
outside off, Clarke backs away too far looking for his customary cut
full delivery, driven out to mid-off
through past the keeper, a wide edge, the first hint of anything Australia have given in a while, this wasn't quite a chance
pushes across the left hander from over the wicket, Hussey tries to pull, gets horribly cramped up and the ball flies off, sighing
wide down leg, Clarke gamely chases it round but is too late on the shot
on off, driven out to mid-on for a well-crafted, important fifty and Clarke takes in the applause
down off, left alone
the ball didn't come on to the bat on off, pulled out in front of mdiwcket, and they get the two, Hussey wants the three, but Clarke is correct in sending him back
pushed out to the covers, driven into the ground and up to the fielder who's watchful where the non-striker's end is concerned, Clarke runs back into his crease
reaches out on middle to tuck into midwicket
low full toss and Clarke's eyes light up as he drives hard at Murali whose upturned hands pushed it up and then he collects at the second time
on the front foot, sweeps slowly into the leg-side
a half-appeal for one which hits the batsman low
finally gets hold of the sweep properly with a working to square
dips on to leg, pushed out to midwicket and the pair do well to come back for the two
waits for the one which comes on middle and he drives out to mid-on for another important fifty following Clarke's
up there on off, driven back to mid-off who gets two hands' worth of fingertips on the ball and they scramble the single
driven out off the legs to midwicket
on off, tidy length, Hopes defends and follows up with a "No!"
outside off, curved away, a play and a miss as Hopes tried to drive to the covers
good-length ball, check-driven into the covers
banged down wide outside off, cut hard to deep point
full delivery, popped up a leading edge just wide of cover, Hopes angling the face as he went for the drive
on leg, a would-be yorker whipped round off the legs behind square
outside off, Hussey can't get on to it and Sangakkara gets the end of a glove on it, the batsmen cheeking through a single
pushed out to the covers and yet again there's a run out chance from Perera, the ball  bouncing over the stumps and into Malinga who could have taken it, the run out was on if so
into the covers this time and though the ball hit the stumps Hussey was well home
driven into his ankle and back towards Malinga
outside off, pulled round through midwicket, thrown back to the bowler
pushed up there outside off, driven out to long on
outside off, driven quietly to the covers
outside off, pushed to short midwicket and they run through
outside off, Hussey was looking to hustle, Amerasinghe singing as the ball was driven sharply into the ground with more than a hint of defence
down leg and got hold of it this time with a work round through leg
up there on leg, pushed behind square, and they ran through
right up there on middle and leg, turned off the legs to fine

on off, pushed a quicker ball past him, Hopes was bamboozled going for the sweep and then wandered out of his crease, possibly looking for the bye, meanwhile Sangakkara almost apologetically, though he gives no inch, took the bails off
Hogg takes the single with a dab to gully and the throw was just wide, Hogg would have been well gone
cramped up there, defended on the front foot
goes for the sweep outside off, the ball misses him, Sangakkara misses the ball and they run through the bye
driven out through long-off now
a yorker outside off, worked out to gully where Dilshan fielded well on the dive
outside off, backs away a touch and cover-drives, the relay throw comes in, Perera muffs it and allows an extra one
pushed up there on off, driven out to long-off this time
outside off, and that's the catch of the day, cut hard to point and it was travelling low, Dilshan snaps it up sharply around his ankles on the kneel
very good yorker, dug out well also
half volley, driven up and over to long-on
driven out to mid-on now
dug out from a near yorker, driven out straight to long-off
on middle and that was dropped by Malinga at mid-on, should have had that, fumbling it on the finger tips with upturned hands
cramped him up outside leg, Johnson didn't know where the rebound went, looked for a quick single and was sent back as Vaas went for the underarm
wideish outside off, driven into the covers now
a good ball from Malinga, on off, left went to cut hard, a bit of reverse swing
couldn't sneak a single as the ball's driven back to Malinga
outside off, cut hard to point and a direct hit would have been close as Hussey slides in at full stretch
wide outside off and a misfield in the covers where the man dives over it and they pick up the two
outside off, driven wide of long-off who throws in hard to prevent the second run
yorker, followed him behind the stumps as he backed away and squeezed it out onto the leg-side

inn2.comm: thats a superb start, full and coming back in to catch Perera on the front pad, was swinging down a lot and height was probably a factor
this one's straighter and tucked to the man at midwicket
springs off a good length and Perera leaves it be for Gilchrist
a tad fuller and Perera meets it with a firm defensive shot to cover
beaten, as he shapes to defend but the ball lifts and zips away
this one's on the stumps and he thuds bat and pad together
edged and taken! Thats a great start for Clark, getting Jayasuriya flashing at a full one and the thick edge is snapped up by Ponting at second slip
extra pace and carry beats him as he pushes down the wrong line
good delivery, comes back in and Sangakkara works it to midwicket
hits a length and squares him up, the ball flies to point along the turf
hint of movement as the ball angles across and lifts considerably again, Sangakkara again plays down the wrong line and misses
its all happening, as Clark seams it off a length and beats Sangakkara again, to end another maiden over, this one a successful venture for Australia
gets forward and drives a fuller one to the man at cover
my that one kicked! Good bounce and the ball climbs through to Gilchrist after it gets Perera fending off the back foot
this one also beats him off a length, the bat just hanging out there limply
straighter and fuller, Perera gets off the mark with a nudge to leg
short of a length and he gets in line to defend it back to Bracken
bit too straight and he turns it wide of Hogg at mid-on for two

and he gets another, pitching on the stumps and trapping Perera, not getting far forward as he goes for a flick, in front of about leg stump ... Rudy Koertzen slowly raises the finger to cue cheers from the partisan crowd ... height is a factor on that one ... lets just wait for a replay ... yes, he was hit pretty high but there doesn't seem to be any bat on it ... the ball was traveling down leg stump and was high ... a tough call against Perera
gets back in his crease and turns one to square leg
gets forward and edges down towards third man for one
again he gets pushed back in his crease and works to midwicket
gets back and defends the ball towards point
full on the pads and thats an effortless clip out to deep square leg
hits a length and brings it in to square him up, edging with soft hands through gully and the slip cordon
back of a length just outside off and he defends it to point
thats a good length but wide enough for him to leave it alone
defends and gets a thick edge along the ground through gully
gets forward and leaves that one be, off a length
on off stump and Jayawardene presses forward to defend
bit of width, he drives on the up in the gap between cover and point
gets forward and defends the ball to the man at mid-on
a bit too wide of off stump, moving away, and he leaves it be
hits a length again but its wide enough for him to leave again
too straight and he drives down to a diving Hogg at mid-on
short of a length on the stumps, worked off the back foot to square leg
a punchy back-foot drive to a short one, but right to Symonds at cover
uses his feet and on-drives a fuller one to the fielder on the ring

slashed and dropped by Symonds in the covers! The ball comes onto Sangakkara quicker than anticipated and he drives on the rise, but the fielder cannot hold on as he flings himself around, would have been a stunning left-handed take
defended on the front foot
full and slipping down leg stump, raps him on the pads but the umpire feels it was doing a bit too much so he shakes his head
typically straight, defended on the front foot in front of off
more defence
this time he looks to launch into a straight drive to mid-off
on middle, good line and length, comes out and defends on the front foot
defended on the front foot with a firm bat which is aimed towards the covers
outside off, Jayawardene waits on the back foot, opens the face and runs the ball down to third man
pushed across the right hander who stays on the back foot and pushes to gully for no run
angles across and way past the batsman who stabs out at it with a forceful cover drive and he stopped running because he thought he had the four
drags it a touch short down off, cut hard to point off the back foot
outside off, punched to the covers off the back foot
on middle, tucked into midwicket and they scramble through a single, there was a chance for a run out at the non-striker's end but Hussey didn't get there in time
played down off the back foot, tight in defence
whistles past the batsman's outside edge at a fair lick
defended ont he front foot this time
defended forward
width outside off and Sangakkara laces it straight at the fielder at cover
outside off and rocketed again, this time to Hogg at mid-off who tidies up, tongue out as per usual
food line again, down off, left well alone
wobble but no dobble in the air, forced up there and the batsman can only defend on the front foot
slower ball prompts the forward defensive
good bounce this time on off, the ball rising up from a short pitch, and hustled back down on the back foot
more swing again, a touch of length allows the drive to mid-off
boomed down the channel, a tight length, left alone
swing in to the left hander, defended on the front foot
some width outside off, helped out through third man off the back foot
up there on off, winched into midwicket, the room too tight for him to get some decent bat on it
angled into the right hander, who drives back out to the covers, picking out the fielder
outside off, can't pierce the off-side ring this time either, straight to the man at cover
nips back in again off the seam, Jayawardene is patient in defence, worked to the covers
cuts back in a touch again, on a good length, defended on the front foot
good length on off, played off the back foot into the covers
good length again on off, driven into the ground onto the on-side
strays on to middle and leg, Sangakkara tucks it neatly into midwicket
on middle, turned into short midwicket by Jayawardene and they ease through
on leg, and pushed forward defensively
boosted up around yorker length, defended on the front foot in line with off stump
defended on the front foot into the covers
driven out to Hayden in the covers this time
defended off the back foot into point
Jayawardene pierces the field with a knife blade, driving through the chink of light in front of point and Hayden pursues
on off, Jayawardene comes out and plays back round through backward square - forced to do something different on the emptier leg-side
driven back past the bowler, slowly, and as the ball is rolling slowly towards the mid-off so Jayawardene calls Sangakkara through and, captain's privilege, steals the strike
width outside off, driven out to point
hey now, Jayawardene finds the rope for the first time in a while, leaning into a most glorious cover drive
oh, good ball from Johnson, just about leaping over the outside edge as Jayawardene shapes to launch into another full-blooded drive
short ball rises up outside off, it's half-fended, half-guided down to third man
pushed full on off, and driven silkily out to mid-off
short on off and Sangakkara takes periscopically evasive action, ducking down and leaving his bat pointing upwards like a flower
outside off, inside edged back over the stumps and the ball will run away with Hopes' hopes of taking a wicket that ball
cut back in again and once more Jayawardene inside edges, but safely
outside off, pushed up on a good length, driven back out to the covers on the up
curved from middle out towards off on a good length, tucked back down off the back foot
pushed him onto the back foot in a line just outside off, defended back down
on middle, and Jayawardene improvises well by swivelling round and helping the ball through fine leg
stays over predictably enough, shuffled into the covers off the back foot thanks to a hint of width and a good eye

pushed across him at a tightish line and a nagging, awkward spit up to Jayawardene who tries to cut but it climbs on him too quickly and he flashes a top edge through to Gilchrist who takes it and throws the ball in the air in celebration
across him, a good length, and defended on the front foot
defended tight on the front foot, the ball pitching in line with off
defended on the front foot
ripped it back past him again, left alone
good length, up there on off, and it's defended forward
well bowled on off, good discipline, tucked with a defensive clip into short midwicket
some wobble in the air, pushed out to mid-off
outside off and took the outside edge as the ball bounced way in front of Gilchrist, not much bounce on this surface. The non-striker's bails came off as Hopes clipped down on his delivery
defended on the front foot now
worked out on the back foot to the cover fielder in the ring
a wide down off
good angle across the right hander, who leaves it
good shape across him, awkward enough to make him push at it defensively, the ball rolling into the covers
outside off, goes for a cover drive and the hotspot camera shows it hit the ground rather than the outside edge
pushed through outside off this time
on middle and leg, rising, and turned off the legs through fine leg - literally as it happens, that was a leg bye
banged in a short one to end this over's proceedings, the ball flashing down off past the grille
a good length on off, comes across to meet the ball and defends into the covers
right up therein line with middle and off, defended on the front foot
outside off, poor timing, pushing straight into the ground, his head rising with the shot, too
pushed up there again on good length, defended on the front foot
good line on off, tight length to boot and it's defended on the front foot
banged in a well-directed short ball that followed the batsman and leapt over the sticks
defended on the front foot in line with off
driven forward to mid-off
outside off, soft hands cut down the ball through gully off the back foot
pushed across him in line with off, more good length and defended on the front foot
pushed on the front foot, defensively
on off, cut into the batsman woh stands firm and defends
good loop, pushed out to mid-on softly
right up there on off, defended forward quietly
some aggression from Sangakkara who launches a strong pull through to deep midwicket
on leg, turned out off the legs quietly to square leg
oh, nearly a stumping there as Silva is deceived down off by Hogg and just about gets his foot back down behind the line. He breathes another day
pushed forward to mid-off this time
defended on the front foot this time
on off, tucked in the air for a second but bounced in front of Hussey at square
more defence, Bracken as tight as a very tight thing
a touch of width outside off and it's swiped straight across the line in front of midwicket
up there and defended on the front foot
stopped on the shot outside off, driven out to mid-on slowly
bent in on middle, driven out with a pish to the on-side and they scamper through like young scamps
bulls-eyed on middle, but Silva is equal to the sweep behind square
repeats the shot, just a lap round the corner to fine leg
outside off, opened the face to guide it down ot third man
opened the face to run it down to the gully region this time, first slip runs out in pursuit
loop on leg, and turned off the toes square

outside off and Sangakkara is nearly run out - twice. Firstly he dabbed just in front of point and there wasn't much in Clarke's shy, then they throw the overthrow ball out to the non-striker's end where Sangakkara has now scrambled
on off, defended forward
outside off, stands tall and runs it down through the vacant gully area
pushed forward and a direct hit from Clarke this time at the non-striker's end
Sangakkara's gone this time with an attempted pull shot which skews high and actually over to the covers where Symonds takes a relatively straightforward catch over his shoulder
on off and Dilshan is off the mark straight away with a forward press that catches the inside edge and veers off square
nudged it behind him for an easy two
eased out forward
this one just drops short of Hayden at first slip who moved well to his right
dragged it a touch short and that's walloped in front of midwicket, Hussey tidies up
ooh, past him down off, a yorker which surprised Gilchrist when Dilshan missed it and he would have been well well out
this one bounced a bit more than anticipated and Gilchrist appeals for the stumping but he is safe
driven out to the covers, no run on though
pushed out to the covers once more
turned off the legs to square
tight delivery, driven out to mid-off
lets that one through on a good length down off
down leg, a bouncer turned round through fine
enthusiastic appeal for a strangle down leg off the glove, but not given
psuhed forward on the front foot
another dot ball
tightened up there, driven out to point
backs well away outside off, pushed to the covers and roundly tidied up
good loop on leg, turned out to short midwicket
defended forward on the front foot
width outside off, whipped over gully with a deliberate aerial steer
pushes to gully on the front foot, they set off, then both head back
outside off, pushed on to the leg side, straight forward, Johnson runs round, turns and shies but the batsman is home
pushed forward now
low full toss, driven out behind point
played out off the front foot to the covers
they squeeze out a single to short midwicket and charge through
driven out to mid-off
